title: Friday, 31st March, 2017

Obamacare & flows: the AHCA vote led to outflows this week from aggressive fiscal stimulus trades (infrastructure, materials, US value); it may also have encouraged inflows to bonds (ex. high yield bonds) and further acceleration of flows to non-US equities (Chart 1).

PM11:10am

Chart 1 is the chart already shared above

PM11:10am

road positioning message: our Bull & Bear indicator remains at 7.0, just shy of contrarian "sell signal"; we believe investor bullishness is light and reluctant; note this week's inflow tilt toward "deflationary growth" assets, e.g. EM debt, IG, tech; euphoria readings requires bout of high yield inflows & falling FMS cash.

PM11:13am

Private client flows chase inflation: "pro-inflation" flows into floating-rate bank loan ETFs, TIPS, value, Japan from BofAML private clients; GWIM asset allocation is 59% to stocks, 24% to debt, 11% to cash.

PM11:13am

Q1 winners & losers: global equities rose 7% outperforming the 2% gain in bonds, US dollar fell 2% (biggest "pain trade"), and commodities were particularly hit, falling 5%.

PM11:25am

Oh, I was talking about Shawbrook

PM11:25am

Let me let Goodbody talk you through this

11:25 am
PM11:25am

rerateMarlin Bidco, a company jointly owned by funds managed or advised by Pollen Street Capital and BC Partners, has this morning announced a cash offer for Shawbrook’s shares at 330p per share (i.e., a premium of 8% to yesterday’s closing price of 304.3p per share). Shawbrook’s shares were admitted to trading on the Premium List of the LSE in April 2015 and shareholders subscribed for those shares at a price of 290p per share. Pollen Street Capital continued to own

50% of the shares in issue at that point though its shareholding has since reduced to 38.8%.

PM11:26am

The offeror had previously proposed that the takeover would be executed via a scheme of arrangement but now proposes a cash offer, with the consequent lower acceptance threshold of 50%. To the extent that the offeror does not gain valid acceptances that enable it to acquire (more than) 75% of the shares Shawbrook will remain listed. Additionally, irrevocables have been received from shareholders representing 6.0% of the share capital

PM11:26am

Prior to any bid speculationShawbrook was trading at 1.4x Bloomberg consensus FY17E tangible book value for a FY17 consensus RoTE of c.20% -an understandable frustration for Pollen Street Capital, the company’s largest shareholder. It is now trading at 1.6x Bloomberg consensus FY17E tangible book value, which on a relative valuation basis, still appears highly attractive given the RoE that the company is generating, in light of its annual double digit earnings growth profile, and in the context of a potentially material capital release in the coming years on the back of a possible migration to the IRB capital regime.

11:26 am
PM11:27am

And a big block with some firm opinion...

PM11:27am

More importantly, the question arises as to how this will play out. The takeover offer will be successful if Marlin Bidco gains valid acceptances for

50% of the shares. Pollen Street already has 38.8% (which it will transfer into the bidding vehicle), irrevocables of a further 6.0% have been hoovered up, so Marlin Bidco just needs another c.5.2-5.3% to take majority ownership of the shares. This is hardly unlikely so we expect the shares to rerate to 330p at the open. The next question is whether Marlin Bidco can gain sufficient acceptances from the remaining shareholders to get to >75% which would allow it delist the company. On the face of itthis could be a challenge given where the share price has been trading recently but the clever bid tactics mean that momentum (on the back of this morning’s expected rerating), together with the fact that Marlin Bidco will own >50% of the shares (and intent on buying morein the open marketpresumably), will help the offerorgetthere(so the scheme of arrangement was probably a smokescreen all along!)–thoughthis could run for a while. As a final comment we note with interest that the intention is that funds advised by Pollen Street who own 38.8% of Shawbrook will be replaced with new funds advised by Pollen Street, indicating that Pollen Street Capital is possiblyusing the offer as a means of ‘taking money off the table’ –in this context we will be interested to see what the relative shareholdings in Marlin Bidco are (and how they evolve shortly after any successful offer)

PM11:27am

Shorter, from Shore...

11:27 am
PM11:27am

We note the announcement this morning by Marlin Bidco regarding a formal takeover offer for Shawbrook Group. In simple terms there appears to be no change to terms previously- i.e. 330p per share in cash plus the final dividend of 2.7p. Marlin Bidco has support of investors holding c45% of the shares (including their own 39% stake). It needs to get over 50% to take control. Indication is that it will leave Shawbrook as a listed entity if it only gets support of between 50-75%, but obviously this leaves others as minority shareholders that are dancing to its tune. It will delist Shawbrook if it gets support of over 75%, which would leave minority holders stuck with a holding in an untradeable equity in not which the principal shareholder has a c6 year investment horizon - not ideal. The Board of Shawbrook Group has yet to respond. We still think this represents a huge undervaluation, but given poor performance by management in defence so far, we would expect this to get done. So 333p should be the go-to price, although we would expect the stock to trade at a discount in the short term. We retain a positive stance. BUY

Integumen

11:38 am
PM11:38am

Integumen, the personal health care company developing and commercialising technology and products for the human integumentary system that may improve physical appearance, hygiene and general health outcomes, today announces its intention to raise £2.25 million and seek admission of its ordinary shares to trading on AIM ("Admission"). Dealings are expected to commence on AIM on 5 April 2017 and the total expected market capitalisation of the Group at Admission will be approximately £8.25 million.

PM11:39am

PM11:39am

The integumentary system is an organ system consisting of the skin, hair, nails, and exocrine glands. ... Hair and nails extend from the skin to reinforce the skin and protect it from environmental... ... The exocrine glands of the integumentary system produce sweat, oil, and wax to cool ...

The risk to ourbullish Q2 call...price action of “3C’s”(China, commodities, credit) deteriorates and signals early synchronized global slowdown

PM11:45am
